messages.message:
is our `release-system` (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/925893352/Release+System#Certifying-a-Release) still working? i’m trying to generate a new celery-app-tasks image for release 21.4.0, the service is certified here https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/certify-service/2578/.

But when I run `release-system get --release=21.4.0 --service=celery-app-tasks` , the image returned is `gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-app-tasks:21.09.27-f057e02ab8 (http://gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-app-tasks:21.09.27-f057e02ab8)` which is not the latest image :cry:
Yeah release-system works fine. let me check…
~To me certify pipeline looks fine~. Maybe @kunal have an idea about why it is not pulling the latest image.
@kunal I think the pipeline didn’t run the release update step? it only pulled the release-system image but did nothing after that

Hey! I think there was a typo in the service_name parameter, it should be `celery-app-tasks` — let me update the documentation though to call out the service names! Also, the jenkins job didn’t report as failure, even though there is an error in the log: https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/certify-service/2578/console, I’ll also look into why that happened!

I re-ran the pipeline and it should be good now!
```kunalgosar:~ kunalgosar$ release-system get --release=21.4.0 --service=celery-app-tasks
gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-app-tasks:21.11.01-f828581a9b (http://gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-app-tasks:21.11.01-f828581a9b)```
